intro: Sanicula brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and other aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Sanicula brasiliensis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and streambanks.
